page.title: 13LLANSTEFFAN AREA: WELFARE
page.content: Two doctors from St Clears (9 miles away) hold surgeries in Llansteffan and Llanybri once weekly, but for some treatment patients have to go to St Clears. Some people go to the Carmarthen doctors. All the doctors make local home visits when necessary. District nurses, midwives and health visitors visit patients regularly; a baby clinic is held weekly. The nearest dentists, opticians, chiropodists and pharmacists are in Carmarthen. Neighbours help in fetching prescribed medicines, etc. Our hospital is at Carmarthen; for some specialised treatment people must go to Morriston or Singleton at Swansea. Meals on wheels are provided for a few disabled elderly people, distributed by volunteers, organised by Dyfed County Council, as is the Home Help service for the Disabled.
